title: en.wikipedia.org_wiki_Keiji_(manga)
transformers_text: Hana no Keiji lit The Flowery Keiji is a Japanese period manga series based on the novel Ichi Mu An F ry ki by K eiichiro Ryu and illustrated by Tetsuo Hara It was serialized in Shueisha's Weekly Sh nen Jump from March 1990 to August 1993 The story serves as a fictionalized account of the life of Keiji Maeda Hana no Keiji is one of best selling Weekly Sh nen Jump manga series of all time with over 17 million copies in circulation 3 An English adaptation was published in Rai j in Comics under the shortened title Keiji Kodansha has chosen to title the series ' The Magnificent Bastard ' 4 Hana no Keiji is based on the novel Ichi Mu An F ry ki by K eiichiro Ryu and illustrated by Tetsuo Hara It was originally published as a one shot manga in issue 50 of 1989 of the sh nen manga anthology Weekly Sh nen Jump released on November 27 The regular serialization started in 1990 in Weekly Sh nen Jump from issue 13 dated March 12 and finished in 1993 in issue 33 dated August 2 5 18 tank bon volumes were published by Shueisha under the Jump Comics imprint between July 10 1990 and November 4 1993 6 7 The series was republished in a 10 volume bunk ban edition by Shueisha published between March 18 and November 18 1999 8 9 A 15 volume kan zen ban edition by To kuma Shot en was released from September 30 2004 to October 29 2005 10 11 In 2003 an English version of the manga was serialized in the short lived anthology Rai j in Comics published by the now defunct Gut soon Entertainment where the first 26 chapters were printed until Rai j in Comics ceased its publication in 2004 No collected volumes were published 1 12 In February 2025 Kodansha USA announced that they had licensed the series for English publication with the first volume set to be released in Q 4 2025 13 In 2008 a Keiji spin off titled Gif D d Naoe Kanetsugu Maeda Keiji Tsuki g atari written by Tetsuo Hara and No buh i ko Horie and illustrated by Yuji Take mura began serialization in Sh inch osha's Weekly Comic Bunch on November 7 12 The series was stopped on August 27 2010 after Weekly Comic Bunch ended its publication 14 Nine volumes were published In 2010 a sequel entitled Gif D d Naoe Kanetsugu Maeda Keiji Sake g atari started in the brand new magazine Monthly Comic Zen on by To kuma Shot enon October 25 2010 15 The manga finished on January 27 2014 with ten volumes being published 16 17 A final arc entitled Gif D d Naoe Kanetsugu Maeda Keiji Hana g atari written by Hara and Horie and illustrated by Masato Deg uchi was published in the May issue of Monthly Comic Zeno non March 24 2014 18 The series finished on October 25 2018 19 As of November 20 2018 fourteen volumes have been published 20 Shueisha released an audiobook version of Hana no Keiji in December 1993 The audiobook stars Akio tsuka as the voice of Keiji Maeda A Hana no Keiji video game was developed by TOSE and published by Yo ji gen for the Super Famicom on November 18 1994 It is a competitive weapon based fighting game which adapts the storyline of the manga from the beginning and up until the F ma Kota r arc Gif D d Naoe Kanetsugu Maeda Keiji Sake g atari has been adapted into an anime television series aired on TV Tokyo on July 2 2013 entitled Gif D d Kanetsugu to Keiji 21 and was streamed on Crunchy roll 22 The 25 episodes series aired until December 17 2013 23
